Summary: Clean, quiet, and updated.  I found the front desk and overall energy of the place to be very nice. Great location.  They have a machine that makes pancakes two at a time.  And all you have to do is press a button.  Beds were very comfortable and clean.  My son had a swim meet nearby. I would definitely go back.
Room tip: We faced the back.  Probably south facing. Quiet.

Summary: Reception staff very friendly, helpful, quick check-in.  Large room and bathroom.  Comfortable bed.  Good size refrigerator if you are staying for a few days.  Breakfast was fine.  But could not sleep!               Air-conditioner VERY noisy.  Some traffic noise.  And just too much light in the room.  Bright clock lights, blinking message light on phone, other small lights.  Covered up phone and clock.  Dark roll-down shades for window, but bright light all around the edges.  Nothing to do about that.  Finally turned off air-conditioner but then it was too hot...
Room tip: Ask for a room on the pool side of the hotel. Maybe a little less noisy.
Manager Response: Hello penguin3,  Your opinion is very important to us. Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your experience at our property. I have shared your observations with our management. I'm sorry to see we did not meet some of your expectations. Please, accept my apology. Our commitment is always combining a feeling of comfort and happiness with exceptional touch to make you have a delightful stay.  Thank you for choosing us for this occasion. Hopefully, we will get to host you again! We just can't wait to show you the changes done.  Alejandro G. Case Manager IHGService

Summary Heading: Great Experience During my Stay at TownePlace Suites
Summary: I am staying in TownePlace Suites Lake Forest (currently for business). My room has all the amenities of home and I have enjoyed my stay, and this has lead to a great performance in my career and increased relaxation in my personal life.   So far, there have been no headaches, and while I did have one question/concern, it was promptly handled by Mike at the front desk. He is an exemplar of customer service, and because of him and the rest of the friendly, helpful staff, I will recommend this hotel to friends and will be staying with TownePlace suites again in the future.

Entered room and found ants in bathroom along shower and on counter top also hole in wall under sink.  Advised person at front desk and he said he would make a note and have it taken care of the following day because he was the only one there.  I asked for a different room and he said they were booked.  He looked in the room behind the front desk for ant spray so I use it but said there was none.  I then told him something needed to be done and to call his manager to get it resolved.  Went back to my room and explained this to my wife.  At this point we were quite upset. What adds to it is the general manager, Levi will walk around and great and talk with his guests. I dont see this any other hotels every. Keep up the good work!

I stayed one night there.  They are remodeling the rooms and they are doing overall a nice job.  The room was clean, well made.  My room came with a refrigerator and 2 double beds and TV.  They told me since they were in the middle of the renovation it would not come with the coffee maker or phone.  I was okay with that. We really do appreciate your concerns and comments. We will revisit them and make proper correction.  We would like to invite back when the renovation is done in few weeks so you can enjoy a full experience of our renovated hotel.  Again, Thank you for being our guest.

Summary: If I could i would give them 10 STARS from Karoline (front desk), James (manager) and Stan (general manager)!! All of them have gone ABOVE & BEYOND to make sure we have had everything we needed to make our stay here comfortable and have helped us with all our requests big or small.  Yes, the location is under major renovations but all three of them have made our stay beyond comfortable. We had to check in here due to our home flooding and our stress level was at our breaking point but they have brought it way down with the the way they have welcomed us and have treated us like family!!!  THANK YOU THANK YOU KAROLINE, JAMES & STAN!!!!!  MUCH LOVE,  The Hernandez Family Roberto, Jennifer & Gnocchi (the puppers)
Manager Response: Woww,  We do appreciate your comments. We are glad that you have enjoyed your visit at the Prominence Hotel and Suites soon to Be the Holiday Inn Express - Lake Forest.  I will share your comment with my staff and I know it will put a smile to their face as it did for mine.  Again Thank you to you and your family for choosing us. You are welcome any time when you visit the City of Lake Forest.

Summary Heading: Don't let the renovations/transformation into Holiday Inn Express keep you away...STAFF & VALUE FOR $$ IS 1st RATE!!
Summary: I had previously visited this facility in October, 2017 and could not have been more pleased; therefore, I had VERY high expectations upon my return last week.  I was greeted at the front desk by a young man with an AMAZING smile named James.  James could not have been more warm and welcoming each and every day when I would see him, and he was very quick to answer any questions I might have and offer helpful suggestions!  He was a true delight, as was every other staff member I came across during my stay!  Unfortunately, it was only upon arrival at the hotel that I discovered that MAJOR renovations were underway, with the eventual outcome being that the Prominence Hotel will become a Holiday Inn Express sometime around the end of the year.   While it's always nice to stay
Manager Response: Hi,  Thank you for you comments. We really do appreciate that you have visited us again and you are inviting other guests not to be fooled by the renovation.  As you mentioned, we are transitioning to the Holiday Inn Express and we would like to invite back when the renovation is done so you could experience the new hotel.  I will share your comment with James as I know, It will make him happy to have delivered such a good service.  Thank you.

Summary: Ii's located in a quiet area of Lake Forest. Older hotel, but the room was pretty clean. We are a tall family, so we liked the high shower heads. Our room was nice enough for a quick stay. We also liked the made-to-order omelettes for breakfast.

Booked for 3 adults a month in advance. Was told only a king with pullout was available as the hotel was sold out. Checked in at 2:30 pm, opened window to air out a funny odor, then left until 11pm.  Pulled the soiled cushions off the sofa to pull out the bed and find an out of order sign under the cushion. Really. Went to desk to complain they put us in a broken room especially when we had checked so early in the day.  The clerk said they were sold out so another room wasn't an option.  Did I mention the room is really dirty, with stains in the carpet everwhere.  The sofa could not be sat on, the out of order sign was due to all of the springs missing on the sofa bed, if you sat on the couch you literally sunk all the way to the floor. My wife, adult son and I checked into this hotel while passing through Irvine. Is well situated with easy access. Check-in was smooth and quick. The room was clean and very comfortable. Staff were friendly and welcoming. Breakfast was a little crowded but well managed by the very pleasant lady preparing everything. Would be happy to stay here again!

Well maintained and hospitable staff. Enjoyed my stay. Will definitely consider for my next visit. With Starbucks and subway around, location can't be any better than This. Breakfast was nice but could have been better with some more options.

Summary Heading: Surprising in a very good way!
Summary: Friendly staff, very clean. I have severe allergies of dust, and didn't have any due to the cleanness of the place. I will stay there again. The breakfast was simple and good. The scrambled eggs with bacon and waffles made my day. I will stay there again

Summary Heading: Expecting More but not getting it.
Summary: After seeing the reviews for this hotel I expected so much more.  Its not that things were bad but they were just barely okay.  The people were friendly and helpful.  From the front desk to the cleaning staff to the cook.  No complaints with the staff.  The hotel is in a nice quiet neighborhood, and yet it seems very transient.  I understand that Orange Co. is an expensive place for a hotel but at 300 for 2 nights I was not happy.  The place really needs updating or at the very least a through cleaning.  The carpets in the halls were quite dirty.  The room was clean but so full of stuff that it was claustrophobic.  The bed was 6in away from the A/C unit.  You had to turn sideways to  enter the bed from that side.  The bathroom door ran into the wall when you opened it.The noise

My wife and I spent 7 nights at this hotel and our stay overall was very good.  The hotel is located in a quiet, lovely neighborhood with easy access to shopping, restaurants and the I-5 freeway.  It shares a parking lot with Subway and Starbucks.  Our room was spacious, clean and comfortable.  The free breakfast was excellent and having a chef prepare hot omelettes, among other daily features, made our stay worthwhile.  Their chef, Edwarda, is definitely a keeper.  However, there were a few disappointing aspects to our stay.  The supposedly heated pool was chilly & filthy with a dirty film floating on the surface and debris on the bottom.  The exterior door to the pool had a key card access but did NOT accept our card and we had to walk around the building to re-enter.

We live nearby but needed an overnight stay to rekindle the spark (aka: a break from the kids). The price was right and they even included an omelette breakfast the next morning. The room was spacious and comfortable. Separate small living room with a flat screen TV and nice bedroom plus a small kitchenette. Great getaway place if you need a place in South Orange County.

Well now the Prominence Hotel stole my money too.  I had 2 nights reserved tonight on 2/17 at the Prominence Hotel. I go there and the guy at the front desk swipes my card 3 times. I was able to stay at this location in October, 2017.  I had done one of the "Express Deals" on Priceline, so I was able to obtain a REALLY good nightly rate and could not have been more pleased when I arrived at the location!  The hotel is an absolutely beautiful area of Lake Forest, and conveniently located in the same parking lot as a Starbucks!  As if that is not enough, the facility is right down the road from just about any restaurant/shopping you could possibly want to visit!  The staff could not have been more friendly and accommodating, allowing me to both check-in early and check-out late...Ana was exceptionally friendly and helpful!  And I cannot say enough about the complimentary buffet/made-to-order omelette breakfast...ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS!!!  The hotel lobby was

The hotel was conveniently located for the conference we attended.  It is a budget hotel located in the middle of a strip mall type shopping complex.  Rooms are good and clean.  Breakfast is very budget.

This is one of the most feel good and take care of you places that I have ever stayed at.  Enter into the lobby and you start to feel good about all of the vibes with purple feel of the Amethyst all around you. Go to your room and everything is very clean and feels good to be here. Get up and have a wonderful Continental Breakfast with the wonderful staff in the kitchen. I highly recommend this lovely hotel. Starbucks is right next door!

We've probably stayed at Prominence more than a dozen times over the past 5 years to visit older son and his family near by- depending on the time of year, rates have been all over- but generally within $15- we assume because of demand. We booked a stay for the Thanksgiving weekend arriving Thanksgiving day and were pleased that the rate did NOT reflect the typical "California gouge-factor"- so rooms were available, ready on time, priced reasonably and include a real breakfast- not just a packed muffin- but eggs, omelets, French toast nicely served. The rooms are starting to get a bit worn and could use some freshening, but have always been clean, good housekeeping and pleasant folks. Just 5 minutes off the 240 toll road on Lake Forest.

This hotel deserves 0 stars!!!  The manager Yoma was absolutely RUDE!!!  Not sure how he got elevated to hotel manager with his horrible manners!  The staff was irresponsive!!!  The toilette flush did not work for 24 hours, the Wiffi did not work, we got to the hotel at 11:30 PM and the front door was closed! We kept on knocking at the door and ofcourse no one is available at their front desk!  DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL! YOU WILL WASTE YOUR MONEY AND GET 0 service!!!

Summary Heading: Second Stay and Loved It Again
Summary: What a great property! They are friendly, clean, and the breakfast here is as good or better than any restaurant. This time around, a daughter and i shared a room for her wedding preparation shopping. We were given a lovely room on the second floor. Every morning, we had custom-made omelettes in the breakfast nook. The staff was helpful and friendly, the room was sparkling clean (though a bit worn), and the service was outstanding. We experienced one small problem, and the front desk people were genuinely apologetic, making notes to ensure that it didn't happen again.   I cannot recommend this property highly enough!

Summary Heading: Worst hotel I have ever stayed at
Summary: I had planned to stay for 21 days..I left after one day and I had to call the Orange County Sheriff to help me leave.  The owner was rude, loud, abusive to me once he found out I had responded to expedia's email asking how the check in, room, and location were.  I had told expedia the truth...my room was horrible, there was a wet spot on the carpet next to the bed, the tv did not work and that a very unprofessional man spent over an hour in my room trying to get it to work.  It never worked properly but I finally just gave up since it was clear they were not competent to fix it.  My keys didn't work.  I spent 10 times going to my room, key not working, and then having to go to the front desk again to deal with the owner who  treated me like I was stupid.. telling me that I was

Was assigned a first floor room about 20 feet from the lobby yet the wifi connection did not offer full signal strength and was erratic. When I opened the connection most of the time the Starbucks a few hundred feet away would appear as opposed to that of the hotel. The hotel offered 'apologies.' The employee stated she had received many complaints but the hotel was unresponsive. Upon check in they were training a new employee and nobody bothered to make me aware of the complimentary breakfast though I did notice when I went to leave the hotel the next day in the morning to get a better wi fi connection. Returned at 9:35 thinking breakfast ended at the customary 10AM but they were closed. Again apologies offered. Room was okay but the blanket was sparse and the pillows were all

Summary Heading: Extremely unprofessional and rude front desk employee
Summary: The hotel itself was fine for the rate - clean (except for the flooring behind the toilet), very quiet, and in a relatively good location. The common areas had an unpleasant smell, but the room did not. The refrigerator in the room also smelled unpleasant so we found it unusable. According to the staff, the computers that are located in the room do not connect to wifi which we found odd. The breakfast included an omelette station, which was nice, but much of the other selections for breakfast ran out before 9am and the staff told us there was no more for the day (even when breakfast closed at 9:30). Specifically waffle mix, so get there early. The staff were generally pleasant, friendly, and helpful. However, one particular front desk employee (Ana) was extremely unprofessional

We had a long stay and the place has been very comfortable. Customer service is very good, housekeeping is excellent, and we enjoyed a complimentary breakfast every morning. Adam at the front desk was always polite, friendly and helpful. Eduarda in the breakfast room has been very sweet. She had a younger female helper with her several mornings, and I can't express enough how grateful I was to see their smiling faces every morning.  There was a grumpy-looking man in the restaurant several mornings - I didn't interact with him, but watched another guest's interaction where this man was very short, on the border of being rude.  Our suite had two TVs (one flat screen and one old cumbersome object) and a computer. I never figured out how to turn the computer OFF, and neither did my

We wisely choose to stay here while attending our grandson's graduation and all the festivities surrounding it.  Prominence's location was very convenient and it allowed us to have our own private sleeping and resting space.  The property, as has been pointed out by many reviewers, is clean and well staffed, but a little worn.  However, for the price we paid, it's a value, especially since they include a good breakfast w/omelets or eggs made to order and some kind of meat.  Plus, my favorite, waffles.  The coffee both in the room and served in the breakfast room was especially tasty   My only complaint with this property is that some rooms have cooking facilities and whatever was cooked in them, wafted up to our room.   I very much resented being awakened late at night by the

Summary Heading: Fine hotel, some worn edges, but a good place to stay, especially for dog owners
Summary: While there were definitely signs of wear, we found this hotel a great place for us and our dog.  Staff was friendly and helpful, fresh omelets in the morning, nice kitchen area in the room with a fair sized refrig,, it was a place we easily recommend, especially if you have a dog.  Room 114 was next to the laundry, but we never heard any noise outside of our room.  Rooms 106,7,and 8 were by the ice machine, so they might have a problem, but given how well our door insulated us, I'm not sure they'd have a problem.

I stayed here as it was close to the office location I was going to be working. The hotel is very simple and a little outdated however it was very clean and the complimentary cook to order breakfast was a plus. There was a lot of non functioning things in the room, when arrived tv was not working so maintenance had to come up and then it was that the tv was disconnected from the cable box, the phone next to the room did not worked, and to turn the water on in the shower felt like the whole wall was coming down. Besides that I think it was ok, at the end is economic option if you want more then pay more to stay someone where else simple as that.

The hotel was clean, front desk staff accommodating, especially the guy working the late night shift, and breakfast was adequate. The rooms are small but efficient. There are some minor issues with torn wallpaper, splatter on walls that was not cleaned and a burned out lightbulb in the bedroom. I would have rated it higher except for one incidence. When we arrived for breakfast on Sunday morning, there were just a few people so we asked him if we could change the channel on the TV. He responded that he had no remote to control the TV. Really? Please be more respectful that your guests are really not that ignorant. I am insulted that you would respond that way. While this may seemed trite, it changed my whole opinion of this hotel.

Summary Heading: The Prominence Hotel & Suites is truly an awesome place to stay.
Summary: The staff is very friendly, the rooms are very clean and extremely spacious. Most of the rooms have a medium-size refrigerator. Also, a decent sized area with a couch, and chair...The most impressive amenity is the breakfast; includes your choice of omelette, belgian waffles (Made from a waffle maker), daily specials which can include corn-beef hash, pancakes, hash browns. They have cereal (Hot & cold), bagels, danishes, toast (Wheat, rye, and white). Their rate is amazingly cheap for what you get (If you have AAA, it's even cheaper)...If you need a hotel in the Lake Forest/Mission Viejo area, STAY HERE!!!

I've stayed at this hotel a few times. The rooms are very large and they each have full sized fridges and a microwaves. The beds are comfortable and it's quiet, even in the front rooms that face the busy road.   The hotel staff and housekeeping go out of their way to make sure you have a good stay.   They have free breakfast daily and you can't beat the price. You could stay at a chain hotel in the area for a lot more.

Summary Heading: Due diligence is a part of any traveler's life.  Do it!
Summary: 1) The stay was nice.  Front desk staff were trained and attentive, breakfast area was clean and equipped but small, room was clean and everything worked, noise level was minimal (though I was put on the front hall two doors from the lobby and had requested back side of motel). 2) Photos on website are mostly stock - country club, dining, etc. - all available in the surrounding region, but this isn't a resort.  It's located on a busy street in Lake Forest, and despite its being set back from the street a little ways, can still be noisy and doesn't provide for that idyllic setting one expects from the photos.  Final word:  A nice place, but not what I expected.

Summary Heading: Very accomodating, comfortable and spacious hotel
Summary: I thoroughly enjoyed my 4 night stay at the Prominence Hotel and Suites in Lake Forest, Ca.  My secretary found the Prominence Hotel on Trip Advisor and knew it would be an ideal place for my stay, as I prefer to have access to a kitchenette since I have some dietary restrictions.  The check-in process was swift and the clerk Nick was informative and welcoming. During my stay I always found the lobby clean and inviting. And even though I do have dietary restrictions I was able to locate some nice food finds in the breakfast room.  I stayed in an Executive King Suite which I found comfortable and spacious.  The room had a good layout; with a nice sized kitchenette and provided cooking utensils, a separate sleeping area with a comfortable bed, and a designated living area with

My company put me up at the Prominence since they have a corporate account with them. I usually stay at big chain hotels, but this stay was just as great. The cook to order breakfast opened early, so I was able to eat the delicious omelettes before heading to work. I can say the whole staff was friendly, and professional from what I encountered.  The one bedroom suite was nicely set up, and comfortable. I liked that fact that I had separate work space outside of bedroom area. It had in-room computer and kitchenette if needed as well. Prominence was a well kept and clean hotel. If I'm here for work again I defintely would stay here again.   Thanks everybody!

The Prominence is an excellent value hotel in overpriced Orange County.  The location is near the toll road, convenient to most of OC.  The hotel is located in a modern and clean industrial and retail area.  The lobby of the hotel was clean and neat.  The person in front of me had an inordinate, but relevant number of questions regarding the large party he was to be with at the hotel.  The desk clerk was extremely professional in his manner with the gentleman.  When I began the check in process, every step was smooth, quick, and efficient.  The desk clerk was just as professional with me, but his humour was outstanding.  The room was neat, clean, and in good condition.  The sofa and easy chair in the sitting area were comfortable and well maintained.  The king size bed was more

As we all know good service starts at the top, and this hotel is no exception.  The General Manager, Stan Yombo, ensures exceptional service from all of his staff. The front desk crew, Curtis, Melanie, Nick, and Kathy are not only friendly, but are also very knowledgeable and helpful.  We had a room on the 2nd floor that included a kitchenette; stove top, microwave, and a full size refrigerator, and of course a kitchen sink! We had a comfortable king-size bed, plus brand new bed pillows that arrived during our stay. Our room, and the hotel in general is very clean, something that is very important to me.  I would be remiss if I did not mention the breakfasts - cooked to order omelets with a nice variety of items available. Various veggies, meats, and cheese were offered. In

Old and dated hotel! Sofas have stains all over.  We had 4 rooms reserved for a wedding. We were told that each room will have extra beds, but instead they told us that rooms with extra beds were all sold out, and to use the sofa beds! My sister paid extra for that,  Breakfast, mediocre. Stay somewhere else!!.

Hotel staff were great and had good banter with all but one, location very convenient, breakfast enjoyable, room comfortable.  We even stayed an additional night.  The only drawback was we had a dog with us and the exit door was broken so getting in and out of the hotel was inconvenient.  Otherwise, would stay there again.

When we checked in, we were told rooms would be ready in an hour, came back in an hours, were told it would be another 2 hours. The clerk at the desk was rude to everyone that had the nerve to ask about the rooms - the waiting room had several guests waiting. Once we got the room, it was clean enough, but at one time it was totally trashed and the repairs were barely surface cosmetic. A piece of wall paper barely glued over a hole in the wall. A fallen shower curtain rod had a large screw underneath holding it up. The toilet seat wiggled back and forth. For the price, this was definitely not worth it.

Please be very cautious or desperate to stay here!  The rates are affordable, location is bad, condition is definitely sub-par to any other hotel I've stayed at (and I stay at A LOT).  Rooms are small and smell of slight mold.  Besides the continental breakfast, everything about this place says stay away.  When I tried to politely and with 24hr notice, to depart/ get away from an extended stay.. I was rudely lied to and argued with.    Maybe I need to write more good reviews for places I stay at that are nice.. But this place sure put it into perspective! Stay AWAY
Manager Response: Mr. Ryan Valley,  Thank you for choosing the Prominence Hotel during your stay in the greater Orange County and Thank you for choosing to stay with us for the next 3 days.  Here at the Prominence Hotel, we are proud to serve guests as yourself. We took your comments in consideration and hope you will enjoy the rest of your stay with us.  Again, Thank you for choosing the prominence hotel.

Summary: When i checked in I told staff the window was broken. That night I said the window was broken. The next morning I was assured the problem would be fixed that day  or I would get a new room. When I arrived back that evening... window still broken and no other room available and they would not upgrade. never ever again
Manager Response: Thank you,  We appreciate your comment and we thank you for choosing the Prominence hotel and suites during your visit in Lake Forest.  Regards,

Summary: Hotel was sold out so they ran out of bedding for pullout sofa. Staff was rude, condescending and unapologetic about the situation. Found a man's loafers under a chair. Sink didn't drain well would fill up very quickly. However, the breakfast was very good and the staff running the breakfast were very polite and friendly.
Manager Response: Hello,  We appreciate your comments and we thank you for choosing the Prominence hotel and suites among all other hotel around Lake Forest.  Thank you

Summary: nice quiet hotel, easy going, easy check in, easy parking, comfortable environment. Simple check in and check out. Would recommend to any one looking for an easy & quiet hotel. Located near toll road.
Manager Response: Greeting,  I am so glad that you have enjoyed your stay during your visit in Lake Forest. We appreciate your comments and we appreciate guests like you.  When your trip bring you back in Lake Forest, please give us a call and we will be delighted to serve you again.  Regards,

Summary: I stayed there many times for long periods and always felt like home away from home. Rooms are very clean and it gets cleaned daily. swimming pool and jacuzzi is there. Best part is morning cooked breakfast. small kitchen is also there in room and they also provide utensils. Very peaceful place and Starbucks is just beside.
Manager Response: Greeting,   Thank you very much for choosing us as your home away home. Comments like yours are so much appreciated and keep us motivated.  As you mentioned, we serve a hot complimentary breakfast every morning and Starbucks is just a step away.  Please, come to visit us again or drop by to say hello. We will appreciate it.  Again, Thank you very much

Summary: $ for $ this was a great hotel.  It is an older hotel, with some old things (like non-digital thermostats that don't work, 1970's looking/sounding refrigerator, and old 1980's office style carpet).   But, the staff were nice, the room was spacious and very comfortable, and it was quiet. Also, for the outdoor people, it is very close to the Whiting Ranch area (El Serrano Trail is right across the street). The pool was tiny.  Super tiny, and only about 3' deep at the deepest.  Spa was also small and needed a little TLC, but it worked.

Stan and Curtis are amazing! Every time I come here I love the service I get. They go the extra mile when taking care of their customers. I highly recommend staying here!   I will always check this hotel first if I'm staying in Orange County! Plus the breakfast and the prices are amazing and I love the entire staff.  Thank you to all of them!

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel In A Good Location
Summary: This was the second time my family and I stayed at the Prominence Hotel & Suites. Last year, we stayed on the 3rd floor, and this year, we stayed on the 2nd floor. Our room was the "Traditional Suite, 1 King Bed with sofa bed and Kitchenette". We had a wonderful experience, with the exception of a few minor things: the flush handle was broken, so it was difficult to flush; the stove was dirty, even though we had never used it; the light in the refrigerator wasn't working; and the carpet had a few stains.  Other than that, everything was great. The room was spacious, and the bed was very comfortable. WiFi was fast and easy to use. The breakfast was very good. It included omelettes, waffles, cereal, yogurt, pastries, etc. The location is amazing: it is surrounded by fast food

First things first, the place was clean and comfortable and in an amazing location.  I have nothing to complain about the rooms.  Yes they are a bit older BUT they are clean.  Service at the front was ok, seemed that there was no one there most of the time.  The breakfast was OK, not bad, not great.  My biggest issue was the parking.  Every night when we came back it was difficult to find a spot.  Other than that, we really enjoyed our stay.  I would come back.

Room was out dated stains on rug. Couch was sad condition. When our people talked to the GM he was rude and more interested in being on a  budget than qualitity of service. We were there for our yearly youth bowling state championship. We reserved 11 rooms and was worst stay we ever had.  Room was 104.

Summary Heading: Loved The Prominence Hotel and Suites!
Summary: Hey everyone! I just stayed there 4 nights recently with our Pekingese and loved every minute! Great staff and management! Will stay again soon. Nice breakfast area too - great location in beautiful Lake Forest.

Summary Heading: Excellent for visiting family in the area
Summary: The room was very nice with kitchenette, the staff was very accommodating and competent, the free breakfast to order was a fantastic plus. There is also a coin laundry. Great experience! We are usually placed at Extended Stay America by Priceline. This time we booked on a different site and very much pleased with Trip Advisor comments. The only downside at all was the dated/well-worn couch in the sitting area. But this was just fine with our son and granddaughters when they visited.

had a very nice room.  2 queen beds.  amenities were more than expected...full size refrigerator, microwave, stove, tv and computer.  room service was good.  the morning breakfast was more than adequate.  Curtis, the hotel  registration clerk was very helpful  our party consisted of 12 senior ladies and he took good care of us.  he deserves a metal!!.

The hotel is clean, quite and has a very friendly and helpful staff.  We needed a hotel that was pet friendly which they are.  The rooms are very nice. I was impressed that the room had a full size refrigerator.  I highly recommend this hotel to anyone needing a hotel in Lake Forest.

Do not recommend this hotel to anyone. The combination of smell in the lobby, elevator and in the room is bad enough to keep anyone away. Not to mention all the stains on the furniture and curtains. The jacuzzi looked really gross, even though I am sure it's due to desperate need to paint the base but it made look water look like urine (although given the quality entire property is in I would not be surprised). We checked in really late and the crib was not ready for us, I'm fully expecting cribs to be first come first serve but it took about an hour to get it and the staff didn't seem very eager to get it for us.

Summary Heading: Are we talking about the same hotel?
Summary: Recently, my husband and I took the advice of several reputable hotel reviewers (AAA, TripAdvisor, etc.) and booked a one week stay at The Prominence Hotel in Lake Forest, CA. Upon our arrival, we were dumbstruck by the appalling condition of our 2 room suite. The curtains were filthy and ripped, the torn lining beneath the bench in the bedroom hung down toward the floor, the couch was SO filthy that we were forced to cover it before even considering sitting down (we were supposed to use it as a sofa bed, but refused to open it for fear of what we might find inside), and the wallpaper in the bathroom was disgustingly dirty around the light switch. The worst feature, however, was an air conditioning system that only turned on when it detected movement in the room. I did not know

The Prominence is my weekend getaway. My home away from home. All the staff is amazing. They take care of anything I may need. Thank you Matthew K. - Supervisor & staff for always making me welcome & feel at home. I appreciate it & I recommend this hotel to all travelers near & far!

All the staff were great, want to give a shout out to Curtis and Matthew K.. Were were there for a softball tournament over the holiday weekend and they were very helpful helping us find places for our girls to eat and accommodating our group with what ever we needed! cooked to order breakfast was good and the rooms were clean and comfortable.

Out in the sticks literally, but not too far from plenty of beaches, restaurants and shops, so long as you're driving. Staff were extremely professional and rooms were big and comfortable with a very nice breakfast served also.

This hotel is an exceptional location for us. Our daughter and grandson live in Lake Forest so we stay at this hotel whenever we visit them.  They also accept our service dog with a smile and make it so easy for us to be able to keep her with us.  The rooms are clean and beds are comfortable. Staff is very kind and meet us with a smile.  This hotel is further exceptional in that they have a hot breakfast you can rely on.

Summary Heading: Good quality hotel right next to a Starbucks
Summary: Surprised to find this facility in Lake Forest.  Needed a two-night stay but they are very popular and could only get a one night.  Very satisfied with room, the bedding, the location.  If you choose this hotel, be sure to reserve for every night you might possibly want.  The price point is quite good.  It is a long way from the 5/405 and the 241 but the drive is easy and well worth it for a good night stay.  I always take a spray can of Lysol wherever I go to attack any smells.  This hotel did not need for me to spray.

Summary Heading: Fancy decor amid the usual amenities
Summary: This hotel is sort of motel like, but that might be customary for the region.  The comfortable, recently updated rooms are enhanced by elegant and showy artwork in the halls and a nice display of geodes in the lobby.  Good value for the money, with a quirky decor to make it memorable.  The breakfast was more of extended continental, but enough to keep you from going out into the world hungry.  The service was friendly and efficient.

Friendly staff with great amenities love the breakfast, had a wonderful stay really easy access to the Toll Roads made my drive to work that much easier in the mornings. Ideal for business stays and leisure stays will definitely return.   Thank you.
Manager Response: Dear Frank, Thank you very much for your candid review of your recent stay at our hotel. Your feedback is extremely valuable to us, as we strive to improve with each and every stay. I greatly appreciate your comments about our Friendly Staff and Breakfast we go above and beyond to make sure every guest has a great stay and look forward to you returning for future stay with us. I Thank you again and have a great day.

Summary: There's a lot to like -- good amenities, excellent free breakfast -- but a poorly supervised housekeeping staff.  On a 3-day stay, I had the following adventures: Upon arrival, the room appeared not to have vacuumed recently and there was no shampoo in the bathroom. On the second day, I left a stained towel on the floor for replacement, but it was re-hung for use, the room was vacuumed, but the coffee supplies weren't replaced (although the pot was cleaned). On the third day, the coffee supplies still weren't replaced, the pot wasn't cleaned, the trash had not been emptied, and I discovered that one of the two cooktop burners didn't work. I visited the front desk twice in an attempt to get coffee supplies, but no one was at the desk nor in the office on either visit. On the
Manager Response: I would first like to apologize for not meeting your expectations we here at The Prominence Hotel pride ourselves in providing excellent customer service at all time. I see that our housekeeping services were less than stellar I hope we can extend and you a hand for a future stay with us so that we can make up for your unpleasant experience you had before. I would love talk to more about this matter feel free to give us call I know we can make your next stay with us unforgettable.I thank you our valued customer.  Sincerely,                 Antonio Bedolla                 Front Desk Lead                 949 900-1288                 lead@prominencehotel.com

Summary Heading: Very practical, quiet and functional hotel
Summary: Very friendly, quiet and clean room, nice free treated water, good breakfast. Included in the price is a service ver useful to me: A shuttle service back and forth to the medica clinic. I will go back there for sure.

Room very well equipped, bed extremely comfortable, check in a breeze,Steve esd very helpful and accommodating.. Wanted to stay extra nite but all booked, will come back.  Free parking, shops nearby, noon check out.

Summary Heading: Great Management Team, Awesome Hotel! Great Week!
Summary: My husband & I had a fantastic stay at this hotel. We stayed in the Executive King Suite. Great size space with a separate king size room, sitting/tv room. computer desk with computer & mini kitchen area. Due to dietary restrictions it was a plus to have a stovetop, fridge & kitchen area.  What a awesome management team.  The entire staff were so helpful & couldn't do enough to make our stay more enjoyable.  The King size bed was comfy with a soft mattress topper.  The rooms were clean & crisp.  We had a mountain view and a very quiet room. The front desk staff were helpful with directions, things to do in the area and our made to order breakfast omelets was awesome! The best part of all of this was the price.  So if you want to vote, vote with your dollar & stay at this
Manager Response: Dear RobertP999127,  Thank you for taking the time to write this helpful review. It was such a pleasure hosting you two! Please be sure to let us know the next time you're in the area so we can be sure to give you the best possible deal on your stay, we really appreciate your business!  Thank you for saying such nice things about our staff. We try to provide the best work enviroment possible so our employees can focus on what really matters to us, our guests! Im also glad that you found your stay quiet, thats about as wonderful a compliment that you can pay us.  A million times thank you, take care and let us know how we can help in the future!

Summary Heading: Poor management ruins a nice hotel
Summary: We've stayed here a few times now and always thought it was a pretty good hotel for the money. Quiet, close to our family and reasonably priced. Plus the rooms have a full sized fridge and stove top with a microwave which helps those of us with dietary restrictions travel easier.   Last weekend it was a different story. The A/C was incredibly loud and right next to the bed. Bring earplugs. The overall cleanliness of the room left a lot to be desired. The hand towels in the bathroom had ugly yellow stains on them. Aside from that, the bed was comfortable, but what is it with hotels and those teeny tiny pillows that are hard as a rock? These are all things that should be easily fixed. I hope they will be.
Manager Response: Dear John L,  Firstly, I apologize that your last stay clearly did not meet your expectations. Your name doesn't bring to mind anyone who's stayed with us several times, but please contact me so i can get more details from you and see if we can make this right between us.   Towels are discussed by the management here incredibly often. We do not like towels with stains, even if they are bleach stains... we purchase a large amount of them monthly so none of our guests have to put up with anything unsightly. So had our housekeeping department noticed the stain, we would not have left it in your room. Everything at our hotel is thoroughly washed after every use, we use the market standard triple-sheeting method to make our beds, so this creates a huge amount of laundry daily, but it is really worth it. Our sheets are all white and that helps us replace what needs replacing and keep things as clean as possible as well. Cant hide anything on white, and thats why our towels and sheets are white.I wish I can know more about what made you feel that the room needed more cleaning, our housekeeping ladies work really hard and its not often that we hear that kind of feedback.  I am also sorry that you felt our AC's are loud. We have the exact same unit in every room, so its interesting to hear that it was only your last room that had this issue. I am also sorry about the pillows, we agree that the full size pillows are just better, so we have started to phase out the square pillows, our apologies.

Summary: Looking for a place to stay near I-5 and Laguna Woods Village, I ended up at the Prominence.  The price was right, frankly, a bit less than other nearby establishments.  It was pleasant, nothing more.  Friendly staff, enjoyable breakfast in the morning, good working AC in the room (although it did tend to condense moisture on the surrounding carpet).
Manager Response: Dear Spritz735,  Thank you for your kind review, nothing more or less than pleasent I feel is a wonderful description of what we have to offer. There is a big difference between pleasent and unpleasent and our product shows that. We offer a safe, clean, and inexpensive travel option here in Lake Forest and we are honored by your 4 star review.   I apologize about our AC unit condencing moisture in the carpet directly below the unit. In the summertime, sometimes our guests choose to run these units constantly \, and as you know, cold objects pull moisture out of the air and it creates liqued water condensation. When this occurs here we look for and spot where this has occured and we dry that area out immediately. Its a preventative measure that saves us from a great many issues down the line.   Thank you again for your review, please let us know the next time your in the area, we would love to find you the best rate possible for your future stay.

Summary Heading: EASY , CLEAN,  SIMPLE, POLITE, & FANTASTIC RATES
Summary: We were treated more professional at this location than other locations throughout all orange county. Extremely  clean with with the touch of hospitality every where. The staff  is so welcoming and appreciates your business. They treat you with respect and care about your stay. Please give this location an opportunity to show you first hand that they really care. Thank you again  for reading our families  great review of this Professionaly ran Hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Mr. Mike t,  Thank you so much for your kind review. We herre at the Prominence really try to make our guests feel welcome at our hotel, because we know how stressful traveling can be, and how important a good welcome is to the experiance. Thank you for comparing us favorably to the other hotels you've stayed at, that really makes our day.   It was a pleasure having you, please take care.

Summary: We have 3 dogs.  We had open house on a Sunday and normally take our dogs to doggie daycare.  However, two of my dogs had surgery and could not go. I found this pet friendly hotel.  We were only there a half a day.  When I checked out, Steve was so friendly.  He gave me $10 off the room. We were comfortable and so were my dogs.  We had air conditioning in the room when it was so hot out that day.

I like the service,receptions nice the bedrooms are good and relax,the service for the breakfast excellent and clean very good everything organized the omelette are good waffle too cereal, oatmeal everything  very good nice

This is a great hotel for the price. The many occasions that I have stayed here I have always received great service. Staff is positive & helpful. There is a nice little pool with a jacuzzi in the back of the hotel which has plenty of privacy. Free breakfast in morning. There are a lot of places to dine & activities for the kids. I recommend this hotel.

Without a doubt the best non resort room I believe I have ever had. Kitchen with 2 burner stove, microwave and about 4 foot tall fridge. Visiting California for birth of my granddaughter and this room was about 40% less than any other room in the Mission Viejo area with less amenities. Room was spotless with the exception of a minor stain on carpet. Another plus is probably the quietest a/c I have heard as well.  Made to order omelets, ham, bacon, pancakes and traditional continental breakfast.   Disclaimer : the pool is about residential size but was not an interest of mine

I stayed here for business; my office is in Foothill Ranch and this hotel is super convenient to that area. At first glance, I assumed this was formerly a branded hotel that the owners had just un-flagged so they could slack on maintenance. What a pleasant surprise!  The rooms have a mini kitchen (2-burner stove, small fridge, microwave), separate seating/dining area and a desk area. Plenty of room, free parking and wifi, free Made-to-order breakfast and helpful staff.   Pros: convenient to everything; 405 nearby; near airport; full amenities; free breakfast; walk to Starbucks, 7-11 and a nearby bar; clean,  Cons: really small pillows, carpeting could stand to be replaced; safe located on the floor which is hard to get to; AC loud

The hotel was very nice and the manager Steve and the breakfast manager were extremely pleasant! Both of them provided us excellent service and they made sure we were comfortable during our stay!! The rooms were pretty nice and comfortable!!

The facility and staff are top-notch. Their rating is well deserved. The rooms are clean and comfortable, and the staff is outstanding. Great breakfast omelettes too. If you are staying in Orange County stay here – you won't be disappointed.

This was our second stay at this property - it was even better than the first.  From the moment we checked in (it was late, 11:00 p.m.) to the time we checked out, our stay was memorable.  The biggest plus this place has going for it is the people.  Justin ran the kitchen and made the most excellent omelettes for us every morning - thank you Justin! All the front desk staff were wonderful and everyone made us feel like they were looking after us in their own home.  The room was well appointed and had everything we needed:  decent sized fridge, stove, microwave, coffee maker, etc.  A full daily breakfast was included and was excellent, as I've already mentioned. We didn't use the pool or hot tub but we did use the laundry facilities which were clean and very helpful to have. We

Clean, up to date, breakfast was fantastic, all the staff was friendly and helpful. Plus the use doterra essential oils!  And the rates were very competitive. I don't know why, but they had beautiful crystals in the lobby.
Manager Response: Dear Robert B,  Thank you so much for your amazing review! We here at the Prominence Hotel take our jobs very seriously and we are so happy that we were able to meet and exceed your expectations! I am so proud of our housekeepers, they do an amazing and hard job everyday and I'm happy to see their work reflected through your words.   Please, should you ever have need of a room in the area we would very much appreciate your business, give us a call and let us know that you've stayed here in the past and we'll get you the best rate possible.

Summary: Steve was very helpful and patient with us and what our needs were, after being flooded out of our apartment. He took the time with us and understood our being frazzled and stressed beyond all belief. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.
Manager Response: Dear Vanessa H,  Thank you so much for your kind review!  We are so sorry about what happened to your place but we are so pleased that you decided to stay with us while that got sorted out!   I'm proud of our little team here for making you feel at home, and thank you so much for your kind comments, it's always nice being noticed.  Please let us know if you ever have need of us, and remind us of your status as a returning guest so that we can make sure to give you the best rate possible during your stay!

Summary Heading: Severely in need of an update
Summary: Pros: -Complimentary breakfast is good with made to order eggs. -Rooms are very spacious. -Starbucks and Subway in the same parking lot. -Free parking.  Cons: -Horrible location a good four miles inland from the 5 freeway. -Outdated, drab and depressing rooms; new bed covers and wallpaper/paint would go a long way. -Spa was not heated, nor was the pool, additionally the pool is very diminutive. -Customer service left much to be desired.
Manager Response: Dear Alwehsh,  I am so sorry that you felt that we merited a 2/5. Any time we aren't a 5 all-the-way we are very disappointed and look ways we can improve any and all of our services.   Thank you for the kind things that you said about our property. In regards to your title, our building itself is only about 12 years old. We consider ourselves a business/budget class hotel. There are a couple properties in the surrounding area who regularly charge two or three TIMES our rate, but despite that discrepancy, we provide a stunningly similar product, a 500sqft guest room with kitchenettes, free wifi, parking, and 24hr a day manned desk, as well as the amazing breakfast that you commented on as well - at no additional charge! We have a single upfront fee  and apart from taxes, that's all you pay. That said, we are continually upgrading our little hotel. Most recently we have replaced the vast majority of our sofas, which have been mentioned here on tripadvisor in the past with some awesome modern leather sofas.  In regards to our location... with so many free mapping services, it is difficult to reconcile how this can be such a serious issue for any traveler who chooses to stay with us. We have an address, which anyone anywhere can look up and decide whether or not our facility meets their specific needs.  We are 20 minutes away from John Wayne Airport. I can say that with certainly because everyday I carpool and everyday I have to go to John Wayne before I come to work. Maybe that's a lot of travel time if your not a commuter, but 20 minutes really doesn't seem so bad when you pay a hotel bill half the price (or a third!) as the hotels alongside John Wayne. Furthermore, a great majority of our guests work at Panasonic, Del Taco, and many other local businesses who have buildings literally a block or two away. We are also incredibly convenient for Lake Forest, Foothill Ranch or Laguna Woods locals who need a place for friends or family to stay, as we are centrally located to all three, just blocks away!  In regards to our pool, we do not claim to have an Olympic sized swimming pool. We have pictures of it online, and guests have also posted pictures, it is true that it is not large, but it is in fact heated. Because we are in Southern California, we do not need to heat it much. In fact, because it is an outdoor poor, the heater usually comes in handy only a bit in the winter. Our hot-tub is in working order now as well, as it usually is. I will say about our pool that while it is not an expansive body of water, it is incredibly clean and well maintained. Our pool servicing company does an amazing job, really really great.  I am so sorry that you felt that our customer service left anything to be desired. We all need to be friendly and helpful at all times, and you can rest assured that we will all diligently review your comments for guidance in our daily work.   We hope that the next time you are in the area you stay with us again and give us an opportunity to better meet your expectations.

Summary: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and absolutely loved it. It's quiet, clean, friendly at the front desk, as well as very helpful. I would highly recommend this place. I just came to have some time to myself and I enjoyed every minute of it! Thank you
Manager Response: Dearest Julie2774,  Well what can I say! It was a pleasure having you stay with us. Occasionally, because of our budget friendly prices, we find ourselves being used as a little home away from home, and I'm so pleased that we were able to provide you with a little respite from your regular routine.   We are honored by your kind comments about our staff, and I am so pleased that you found our front desk staff helpful.   Thank you again, and please please please, next time you need a getaway, let us know that you stayed with us previously so that we can do our best to find you the best rate possible.

Summary Heading: Very poor customer service from front desk staff
Summary: My daughters and I just returned from a 5 night stay.  Location was convenient for what we were there for. Front desk staff (both young ladies who worked the day shift) were extremely unpleasant.  One of the days, we left the room at 10:30 am and returned at 3:45 pm and Housekeeping never cleaned the room.  When I approached the front desk, they said Housekeeping was finishing for the day and would not be able to clean our room. (they offered us clean towels and sheets so that we could make the beds ourselves. When asked if I could speak to the manager, was told that there was none around during the weekend.  In the room the sink was slow, the safe was not working and the bathtub had rust stains.  Staff did not offer toiletries for 3/5 nights.  Breakfast offered (included) was
Manager Response: Dear Dcames,  No matter the cause, I apologize that you did not have a completely wonderful experience with us. While we are not a 5 star resort, we pride ourselves on having a clean, budget-friendly hotel that strives for perfection, and anytime any of our guests are not pleased with us we look for what we can do better.   In regards to the housekeeping issue you experienced during your stay... when there is a DND sign on our guest doors we take that to mean that you do not want your room to be visited by a housekeeper that day. I understand that sometimes you had it on from the night before, and perhaps you remove it later in the morning, but unfortunately we don't have a real-time way of tracking which rooms still have it on and which don't. It's just best as a general idea that if you want service during your stay to not have that sign on your door so we can be sure to service your room.   I am glad that we were able to provide you with freshly cleaned towels and sheets immediately upon request.  In regards to our coffee, I'm surprised that you didn't enjoy it. We provide our guests with 100% organic and rain forest certified Brazilian grounds which are provided in complimentary in room packets and during breakfast hours. In regards to our waffle-maker and toaster, I can assure you that they have not been out of commission or pulled from use at all this year. The waffle-maker, although intimidating to use as it's not a device non-hotel goers encounter commonly, is actually pretty simple to use as you only have to turn it once and it beeps to let you know to turn it, and it beeps when the timer reaches zero to let you know to remove your waffle. We have further simplified the process by having a batter dispenser with labeled batter measuring cups.  I am very sorry if any staff had any shortcomings with you what-so-ever. We review every review here in-depth with all staff and I can assure you that your voice has been heard. Thank you.

Summary: I've stayed here a couple of time while having work done on my house.  The hotel is convenient to Loan Depot and other Lake Forest/Foothill Ranch businesses.  There is a Starbucks in the same parking lot.  Breakfast is included.  My only issue was a lack of hot water in the shower.
Manager Response: Dear Michael F,  Thank you sooo much for your kind review! 4/5 stars is a great rating, but we are so very sorry about hot water being an issue during your most recent stay! A number of factors could have contributed to this, but as someone who enjoys hots showers as well, I completely understand how it's just not the same unless it's just right.   We look forward to having you again, and making this up to you on your next stay. Make sure to book directly, reference this posting when checking in, and ask to speak with Steve or Yombo, we'll take care of you.  "Let me bring peace into moments of chaos."

Summary Heading: Stayed a week and will return
Summary: Great location. Quiet, clean, friendly staff, good internet access and staff cooked omelets every morning. Pool and hot tub was crystal clear. A Starbucks is located across the parking lot. We will stay here our next visit and highly recommend it. You receive a lot for a very reasonable rate.
Manager Response: Dear Psk60,  Thank you very much for your kind review. We are so thankful that you and your family decided to stay with us and we agree that we provide a fantastic bang for your buck.  We are so glad that you enjoyed our breakfast throughout your entire stay.  Thanks for mentioning our pool as well, we make sure that the pool gets topped off and serviced every few days, especially in the summertime... no one wants to swim in an icky pool.  We thank you again for your stay, and I sincerely hope we see you again the next time you're in the area!  "Only when you first bring peace to yourself, can you then take it to others."

Summary: Check-in was fast, and my room was great: king bed, desk and chair, full kitchenette with two-burner stove, microwave, and refrigerator, plus a living-room area with a pull out bed, coffee table, chair, and end table. For a five-night stay, this was beyond perfect.  The staff was friendly and helpful. Maid service was on the late side, but that wasn't any sort of problem. The cleaning people accommodated my request for extra coffee, too. No complaints there.  Breakfast was outstanding. Made-to-order omelets and other breakfast foods were excellent. The room is a bit crowded, but it seems that's the case in a motels. There were certainly enough choices for almost anyone. From breads to fruits and dairy products, it would be difficult not leave full.  This friendly place even
Manager Response: Dear DTPegasus,  Wow! Thank you so much for the kind review! We have definitely worked on having a quick and easy check in processed and we are so pleased that you noticed.  We love that you enjoyed out breakfast, it's hard to keep people happy when it comes to our breakfast options, especially when they stay with us for a long time, but thankfully our breakfast staff does a good jobs giving people lots to choose from.  Thanks again for being such lovely and kind people. We would be happy to have you stay with us anytime!

Summary: Me and my two kids stayed at prominence hotel in Lake Forest for about a week and a half. We had a very pleasant stay and the staff was amazing. I've stayed at extended stay hotels before and nothing compares to prominence the pricing was better and they had more to offer including a great breakfast buffet and a pool! Steve was always helpful and friendly working the front desk and was always happy to help never acted once like you are bothering him. Again the price is right the staff was wonderful and that made a very hard time better!

The hotel has a great look to it.  Our first time at this hotel.  The staff during checkin were very friendly.  The room was a kitchenette however, the fridge was turned off.  Since we had a cooler with ice, we didn't use the fridge.  A/C was off upon entering so turned it to 76 and then left.  Upon returning later that evening, the room was freezing.  No matter what temp tge A/C was set, it was cold.  We made it through the evening.  When I reached for the phone to call the front desk, someone put the hand device of the cordless phone on backwards and therefore, had no charge.  On our way to breakfast, downstairs, we told the gal at the front desk.  She wasn't the friendliest person; what a contrast from check in.  A maintenance man was at our room an hour later.  The unit was

Very happy we were in room on 2nd floor because this was the slowest elevator I've ever seen.  We had suite and while the king bed was good the hide-a-bed in living area was terrible (obviously not unusual).  The 2nd floor hallway smelled odd, not sure what it was, but this did not affect the room we were in.  The pool area was very small with a limited number of deck chairs.  On the bright side the cooked to order omlettes were decent but you had to sort of stumble around other guests because the breakfast sitting area was pretty small.  I would say that the staff we interacted with were pleasant and the cost was reasonable compared to other properties in the area.  Bottom line probably would not stay here again as I think I would get a lot for a relatively modest increase in

My husband and I have taken our pet dog here three times.  We have enjoyed staying here very much. The rooms are quiet, clean, and nicely furnished. They have a pool, hot tub, and the best free breakfast in Lake Forest.  They have ready-to-order omelettes, bacon, fried ham, waffle maker, bagels, croissants, and so much more.  This hotel is close to many fine dining restaurants including Lucille's BBQ.  We like staying here because we believe it is the best pet friendly hotel near San Clemente, Laguna, and Dana Point.   There is a twenty dollar pet fee added each night, but it is worth it.  On a frustrating note however,  we have experienced refrigerator and kitchenette faucet problems.  Also, the pillows are somewhat uncomfortable.  On our most recent visit, the male breakfast

Had the best stay. Great breakfast. By breakfast I mean biscuits and gravy, corned beef hash and made to order omelettes. The staff is very caring, accommodating and go to great lengths to give great customer service. Especially the night clerk and morning clerk. This is what a hotel should be like. Great value and great stay. Also a computer in the room for the kids. Big refrigerator and a roof inside of a room for privacy. Will definitely stay again

Summary Heading: Nice hole in the wall location! QUIET!!
Summary: I booked two rooms through Hot Wire. Our rooms were nice with tiny living room area with frig and stove area. Staff friendly. We faced the street and it was totally quiet. Our other room faced the hills so quiet, too. Breakfast included a woman making omelets, french toast and sausage. There was a waffle machine, cereals, fruits, yogurt, many tea flavors and coffee and juices. A very good value for this area. Very pleasantly surprised but other people's reviews were accurate. This is a nice small hotel.

After checking for a moderately priced hotel I found this one.  I ignored the negative reviews and am so glad I did.  The staff was helpful and professional.  The breakfast surprisingly good.  They have an omelette cook that makes them to order in addition to the regular waffle maker, great coffee, juice, etc., etc.  The room was clean and the bed comfortable.  It was quiet and clean. The location excellent.   If you are looking for 5 Star - this is not for you.  If you are looking for very good....you have found it.

I have been traveling to LF for last 4 years and Prominence Hotel has been the preferred staying option since I opted for it almost 4 years ego. The experience gets better and better with each visit.   Daily room service,  complimentary breakfast with a vast variety to chose from,  in room free WIFI,  shuttle service  and above all excellent people motivated to make you feel just like Home.   Definitely the Most recommended hotel in Lake Forest !!
Manager Response: Dear Uptal,  It was such a pleasure having you stay with us. We always appreciate your stays and we are so happy that you've already booked your next trip.   You honor us with your kind words about our service and amenities. We are glad we have been able to meet your standards.   "Everything has it's beauty, but not everyone can see it."

Summary Heading: Very comfortable, a nice, interesting stay
Summary: Having time to prepare for special appointments in two separate directions in SoCal, we did some prepatory work.  Chosen a lodging location equidistant from both locations, reviewing and settling on our lodging choice by comparing recent reviews, then some final investigating on the lodging itself, including when possible, Management and Staff backgrounds.  In this case, our choice of the Prominence was our first acquaintance with the Lake Forest area and the Prominence Hotel. Our check-in at 4pm, on 5/18/15, was by phone confirming our reservations made several days earlier.   Exterior appearance of the Hotel was neat, clean, with a welcoming appearance, having conveniently located parking areas, including three ADA marked spaces conveniently located for checking-in, and a

I stayed at this hotel for a month while relocating to the area.  It has been an A+ experience.  As I travelled home on the weekends, each week afforded me the opportunity to try new rooms on different floors.  All the rooms I stayed in were clean, quiet and comfortable.  The breakfast here is awesome; omelets made to your liking, fresh waffles, fruit, great coffee and more.  I'm already planning on booking family members here when they come to visit me.  You will absolutely have a positive experience and get incredible value for your travel dollar, whether staying for business or pleasure.
Manager Response: Dear Jennifer,  We so appreciated your stay and now that you're gone we miss you dearly! We are glad that we were a good stopover for you during this period of transition.  We are so honored that you consider us an A+ establishment and we look forward to hosting you whenever the need arises.  "Peace is not merely a distant goal that we seek, but a means by which we arrive at that goal."   -MLK

Summary: Easy reservations for handicapped room with bathroom with grab-bars and shower seat. Best breakfast buffet in Orange Count with omelets and waffles.  Facility is clean and attractive, staff is very helpful.
Manager Response: Dear Suslus,  We are so glad we were able to accommodate your needs during your recent stay. Even under the best of circumstances traveling can present a challenge, but we here at The Prominence understand this and try to make our guest's stays as uneventful and satisfying as possible and I am glad that in this case we hit the mark.  We definitely agree with you in regards to our breakfast... ours is second to none!   Please have safe travels and remember, should you ever need to return to Orange County our little hotel is here!

Summary: My wife and I stayed at the prominence for a week and it was very nice. We stayed in a clean and quite room. I made sure to enjoy the free breakfast every morning. I will stay at this hotel next time I am in the area visiting family.
Manager Response: Dear Dean H,  We are so honored that you and your family choose to stay with us. Thank you for noticing our cleanliness, our housekeepers are the hardest and most thorough in the business and we are proud of the work they do, day in and day out. We are also glad you enjoyed our breakfast, one of the best amenities we offer and which is unheard of in our price range!  Thank you again, we hope to serve you the next time you visit Orange County!  "If you don't believe in ghosts you've never been to a family reunion."   -Brilliant

Summary: Its my first visit here and the staff at prominence has gone out of their way to make  me feel at home. The housekeeping staff is very good at their work,providing services everyday. The breakfast menu is very diverse. The hotel staff is very friendly and helps us in every way they can. They also have shuttle services to our work place. Its the most recommended place to stay if you are visiting lake forest.
Manager Response: Dearest Kristel,  I am so happy that we did a good job making you feel at home! Yes I completely agree that our housekeeping is great. We are glad that our breakfast options kept you satisfied during your week long stay. We make sure to try not to serve the same thing in a 7 day period so we appreciate you having noticed this!  I hope you let us know if we can help you in any way! Thank you so much.  "The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others."

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, good staff, clean rooms, great break fast......
Summary: I have been staying in this hotel for several years, whenever I visit Lake forest.   Staff is very helpful, polite and supportive. They are very caring about individual needs.   Housekeeping is done everyday - Rooms and surroundings are always neat and clean.   Breakfast is really good - we get to customize omelette - We can choose our choice of veggies / Jalapenos / Cheese / Meat. Service is very quick. They also have fruits, Juices, pastries, breads, pan cake, flakes, different flavors yogurt... Everything for a rich & heavy break fast :-)  In the evenings, we get Yummy cookies too....  Wifi is free. Hotel also provide all cooking utensils for those who prefer to cook their food.  There are number of restaurants too around - Chinese, Italian, Japanese..you get mostly all
Manager Response: Dearest Horizon R,  We are so incredibly grateful for your amazing loyalty. We work hard to treat every guest like family and we are glad that is has rewarded us with your stays  year after year.  Our breakfast and housekeeping staffs would like to thank you for your kind comments. Our guest services staff thank you for your wonderful personality and coordination.   It is truly our pleasure to host you. Thank you once again.  "There is no hospitality like understanding."

Summary: This hotel is like a hidden gem! Literally. You get way more than what you pay for. Bomb breakfast, parking, Wi Fi that actually works, it's all included. The front desk staff are very friendly and helpful. No hassle checking in or out which is always a good thing specially if you dislike waisting time. Overall great experience and if Im ever in town again, I know where I'll be staying.
Manager Response: Dear SeanP005,  Thank you for your awesome review!  Thank you for the veiled reference to the gems that we have in the Lobby. It's just our little lobby decor, but we are very proud to have such a glimmering lobby. We agree that you get an amazing bang for the buck here, wifi, parking, breakfast and a great and clean room for the lowest prices in town.  Thank you for noticing our quick check in and check out. This is an area that we have focused on because we know our  how important this for busy people on the go. If we keep you at our desk for longer than a minute or two, we have work to do!  Thank you so much for your stay, we loved having you and look forward to hosting you again in the future!  "Do not shrink from showing hospitality to strangers, for often they are angels in disguise."

Summary: My 2 night stay could not possibly have been any better. The staff here is amazing, all very nice and helpful. The rooms are spacious and accomodating. The breakfast in the morning was like the cherry on the ice cream. They have a lot of variety and they even have a cook to order omelette station! It was a bit rowdy and crowded in the morning but they placed us in a separate (quiet) room to enjoy our breakfast. It definitely surpassed my expectations and I would most certainly stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear OregonCW,  Thank you so much for choosing to stay with us and for your kind review. It was a pleasure having you, and please be sure to let us know if you have need of a room in the future.   We are super glad that you enjoyed our great breakfast, and although we were able to give you a quieter place to enjoy your breakfast, we are sorry that it got rowdy that morning. We happened to have a team of very excited teenage softball players and I'm sure they were really looking forward to playing that day... none the less sorry for any disturbance.   "The only person you are destined to become is the person you choose to be."   -Emerson

Summary: When I arrived at the Prominence, the front desk staffer had gone down to the Jack in the Box to grab dinner. He left a women who appeared to be from housekeeping in the lobby to let arriving guests know he would be back in five minutes to check in guests.  My first room (106) smelled of urine when I walked in the door. I sat down on the bed to determine whether I really thought that’s what I was smelling and whether I should request a new room, and sat right on the place on the bedspread that reeked most strongly of urine. I requested a new room.  My second room (102) had stains and tears on the couch. I would not consider sitting on it and it left me generally uncomfortable about the cleanliness of any upholstered furniture.  I ended my stay the next morning. The front desk
Manager Response: Dear Ms. Becky H,  Thank you for having stayed at our hotel. We apologize profusely for the issues you encountered during your stay. We consider ourselves a Budget/business hotel and we are always greatly saddened when a guest does not have a 5 star stay with us. I have contacted you personally to speak about this matter and to see if we can have an amicable resolution to these issues.  I apologize that you found an unappealing smell on your room's comforter. As a matter of fact we are in the process of phasing out our rooms comforters, and we are now applying the industry standard of triple sheeting our beds sans comforter.   We are very pleased that our staff member was able to check you in seconds after you entered our lobby. We are also very pleased that our staff member immediately offered you a different room to stay in as soon as you reported a issue with your room and that he apologized profusely for the issue.   We apologize that you did not find the furnishing appealing in your second room. We are a small hotel and consider ourselves a great bang for the buck, but we are steadfast in our commitment to room cleanliness and quality. As is evidenced by the large amount of our reviews, we often hit the mark, and if we fail any guest we are more than happy to have a dialogue about any concerns and resolve them immediately and to the best possible outcome for both us and our guests.  I responded to the similarly written email that you sent and I hope you are able to stay with us in the future and re-evaluate our facility.

Summary: Full disclosure, I'm a high maintenance traveler.  That said, here's my review.  I loved the entrance!  Amethyst geodes all throughout the lobby!  Staff were extremely friendly and helpful.  The room was just okay, it was a little tired to be honest.  The desk chair and carpet were stained and there were a few little things here and there.  I only paid $90 so my expectations should have been lower but the website looked so luxurious!  It was perfect for $90 though.  I just needed to be near the toll road in the morning so it served it's purpose as a place to sleep.  I did not try the breakfast, I just went down to grab a coffee.  People were raving over the breakfast though so if that's your thing, then this is your place.  There is a subway and a starbucks in the parking lot as
Manager Response: Dear Ms. Bing,  Thank you so much for your thorough review!   We are a business/budget property and we so appreciate reviews and feedback from a businesswoman's perspective as we find this demographic to be a rapidly growing market-share who's needs are not yet being fully met by the hospitality industry as a whole.   Thank you for your wonderful description of our lobby and staff attitude. We place high value on good customer service because we know that a cheerful and friendly face after you long day is just as important as anything else in our business  We apologize that you found stains anywhere at all in our room and we will be examining this issue closely and clearing it up.  Lastly, thank you for calling us "perfect for $90"! We are a small business/budget hotel, but we pride ourselves on providing a great value and having the best rates in the area for our guests.  Thank you very much, please contact me the next time you would like to stay with us so we can see if you qualify for a business rate!

Summary: I have stayed at this hotel many times over the years, but during my stay a week ago in room 211 I contracted terrible bed bug bites.  After receiving a runaround from the manager, and a highly unsatisfactory call with GM Mr. Yombo, I stopped by the property today to show the GM the bites on my leg in person.  I was asked to leave the premises for my trouble.  Mr. Yombo does not take seriously legitimate customer complaints.  Neither me, nor any of my employees, will stay at this property again!  Very poor response by hotel management to a legitimate complaint!
Manager Response: Dear Dan H,  As I mentioned in our numerous conversations about this issue, we categorically and respectfully deny your claims, and we find the circumstances in which they arise very odd.
